title: Punjab National Bank spurts 1.74%, up for five straight sessions
description: Punjab National Bank is quoting at Rs 35.05, up 1.74% on the day as on 12:49 IST on the NSE. The stock is up 12.16% in last one year as compared to a 55.77% gain in NIFTY and a 57.7% gain in the Nifty Bank.

title: Did 'NRI belt' of Punjab contribute to spike in UK variant in Delhi through 'farmer protests'? Read details
description: In March, about 80% of coronavirus samples in Punjab had the UK variant which may have come through the NRIs visiting their ancestral homes. Delhi recently reported 50% samples had UK variant. | OpIndia News

title: Hemkund Sahib pilgrimage deferred
description: Was scheduled to start from May 10 Amid spurt in Covid-19 cases, the pilgrimage to Gurdwara Sri Hemkund Sahib has been postponed till the situation gets better. title: Delhi hospitals swamped, Covid patients being taken to Punjab for treatment | Ground Report
description: As Delhi grapples to manage adequate medical oxygen and ICU beds, coronavirus patients are now being admitted to hospitals in Punjab for treatment.

title: COVID-19: Amarinder against lockdown, says situation expected to get worse in Punjab
description: The CM said the situation is expected to worsen, especially in south Punjab, where Ludhiana district alone reported 1,300-plus cases on Sunday Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh here on Monday said he is against the imposition of a coronavirus lockdown even as he predicted that the pandemic situation is expected to get worse in the state.

title: Punjab announces daily lockdown from 6 pm to 5 am and weekend lockdown to stem COVID surge
description: The Captain Amarinder Singh government has declared a weekend Punjab lockdown from Friday 6 pm to Monday 5 am.

title: Covid 19 Vaccine: Jimmy Sheirgill to Jaswinder Bhalla, Punjabi stars who took the first dose  | The Times of India
description: The new wave of Covid-19 has made the scenario worst than ever, and therefore everyone is trying to take the best precautions possible. At the same time, the Covid-19 vaccine is also working as a messenger of relief for many. Though the vaccine helps boost the immune system against the novel virus, one has to take preventive measures like wear a mask, maintain social distancing after the dose, and more. After taking all these things into consideration, Punjabi stars have also got their first dose of the vaccine and have made themselves stronger against the virus.Below is the list of the Punjabi stars who took their first dose of the Covid 19 vaccine:Pic Courtesy: Instagram

title: Covid-19 impact: Punjab Vidhan Sabha speaker postpones marriage of his son
description: CHANDIGARH:  The sudden surge in Covid-19 cases in Punjab and other states has forced Punjab Vidhan Sabha Speaker Rana KP Singh to postpone the marriage of his son. The marriage was scheduled for May 7, 2021.

title: COVID-19: Punjab govt provides 147 oxygen concentrators to worst-hit districts in Malwa region
description: Chandigarh (Punjab) [India], April 25 (ANI): In order to ensure adequate supply of medical oxygen to the needy critical patients on life support, the Punjab government has provided 147 oxygen concentrators to the worst-hit districts in the Malwa region of the state, which were reporting the maximum daily COVID-19 cases and highest positivity rate.

title: Punjab to recruit 400 nurses and 140 technicians to tackle COVID-19 crisis

title: Death rate low, but new Covid infections spiral in Punjab
description: The average Covid fatality rate of Punjab, which stood at around 2.6 per cent since the virus outbreak, has dropped to 2 per cent during the second wave, and was only 1.4 per cent last week.

title: Current oxygen demand for 105-110 MT likely to shoot up, Punjab looks to Centre
description: While the average demand for medical oxygen was 15-20 metric tons before the pandemic last year, it has shot up to 105 to 110 MT currently.

title: Punjab Officials Transport Oxygen as COVID-19 Cases Surge in India
description: India’s Ministry of Railways delivered liquid oxygen to a gas manufacturer in the city of Kapurthala on April 22 as the country faced record COVID-19 cases and medical oxygen shortages.India reported the world’s highest single-day spike in COVID-19 cases on Thursday, with more than 314,000 new cases.This video shows a vehicle from Indian Railways’ Rail Coach Factory in Kapurthala delivering liquid oxygen to a gas manufacturer that supplies medical oxygen to Guru Nanak Medical College and Hospital in Amritsar, the ministry wrote in a tweet. Credit: Ministry of Railways via Storyful

title: 4,333 persons tested positive for COVID-19 in Punjab
description: In Punjab, during last 24 hours 4,333 persons were tested positive for Covid 19 and 51 have lost their lives due to this infection. Punjab Health department said 2478 Covid patients have been cured during last 24 hours.

title: Covid-19: Punjab CM writes to Centre, seeks postponement of CBSE board exams
description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh wrote to Union education minister Ramesh Pokhriyal requesting the cancellation of these exams. The CBSE boards are scheduled to be held from May 4 onward.

title: Punjab gets four lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses from Centre, sufficient till April 15
description: "We had demanded 15 lakh vaccine doses in meeting with Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan but received only 4 lakh doses on April 11, which is sufficient for vaccination till April 15," Sidhu said.

title: 3,003 new COVID-19 cases in Punjab; 53 deaths
description: There are 28,184 active cases in the state The coronavirus tally in Punjab rose to 2.79 lakh on Tuesday with 3,003 new infections, while 53 more deaths took the toll to 7,609, a health bulletin said.

title: Pakistan's Punjab govt extends smart lockdowns in COVID-19 hotspots
description: Islamabad [Pakistan], April 13 (ANI): In view of the incessant surge in daily COVID-19 cases, authorities in Pakistan's Punjab province on Tuesday announced the extension of smart lockdowns, enforced in COVID-19 hotspots, till April 26.
